executable.title: Volume Rendering
executable.description: Volume Rendering Module provides advanced tools for toggling interactive volume rendering of datasets.
executable.contributor: Julien Finet (Kitware), Alex Yarmarkovich (Isomics), Yanling Liu (SAIC-Frederick, NCI-Frederick), Andreas Freudling (SPL, BWH), Ron Kikinis(SPL, BWH)
executable.acknowledgements: This work is part of the National Alliance for Medical Image Computing (NAMIC), funded by the National Institutes of Health through the NIH Roadmap for Medical Research, Grant U54 EB005149. Some of the transfer functions were contributed by Kitware Inc. (VolView)

parameters.label: Inputs
parameters.description: Contains the list of nodes required for VolumeRendering. It is unlikely that you need to interact with controllers.

parameter.label: Volume
parameter.description: Select the current volume to render. Note that only one volume can be rendered at a time.

parameter.label: Display
parameter.description: Select the current volume rendering display properties. Volume rendering display nodes contains all the information relative to volume rendering. They contain pointers to the ROI, volume property and view nodes. A new display node is automatically created if none exist for the current volume.

parameter.label: ROI
parameter.description: Select the current ROI to optionally crop with 6 planes the volume rendering.

parameter.label: Property
parameter.description: Select the current Volume Property. Volume properties contain the opacity, color and gradient transfer functions for each component.

parameter.label: View
parameter.description: Select the 3D views where the volume rendering must be displayed into. If no view is selected, the volume rendering is visible in all views

parameters.label: Display
parameters.description: Main properties for the volume rendering.

parameter.label: Preset
parameter.description: Apply a pre-defined set of functions for the opacity, color and gradient transfer functions. The generic presets have been tuned for a combination of modalities and organs. They may need some manual tuning to fit your data.

parameter.label: Shift
parameter.description: Move all the inner points (first and last excluded) of the current transfer functions to the right/left (lower/higher). It can be useful when a preset defines a ramp from 0 to 200 but your data requires a ramp from 1000 to 1200.

parameter.label: Crop
parameter.description: Simple controls for the cropping box (ROI). More controls are available in the "Advanced..." section. Enable/Disable cropping of the volume. Show/Hide the cropping box. Reset the box ROI to the volume's bounds.

parameter.label: Rendering
parameter.description:
Select a volume rendering method. A default method can be set in the application settings Volume Rendering panel.
    VTK CPU Ray Casting: Available on all platforms, the volume rendering is entirely realized on the CPU (default)
    VTK GPU Ray Casting: Available on all platforms, fastest method to volume render
    VTK Multi-Volume (experimental): GPU ray-casting enabling real multi-volume rendering. Some features are not yet available, such as shading or cropping. Available on all platforms.

parameters.label: Advanced
parameters.description: More controls to control the volume rendering. Contains 3 tabs: "Techniques", "Volume Properties" and "ROI"

parameter.label: Technique
parameter.description: Advanced properties of the current volume rendering method.

parameter.label: GPU Memory Size
parameter.description: Amount of memory to allocate on the GPU for volume rendering. By default, all the memory of the GPU is allocated. You can change the default behavior in the application settings Volume Rendering panel.

parameter.label: Quality Control
parameter.description: Not supported yet.

parameter.label: Interactive speed
parameter.description: Ensure the given frame per second (FPS) is enforced in the views during interaction. The higher the FPS, the lower the resolution of the volume rendering

parameter.label: Synchronize with Volumes module
parameter.description:
Click: Apply once the properties (window/level, threshold, lut) of the Volumes module to the Volume Rendering module.
     Toggled: By clicking on the checkbox, you can toggle the button. When toggled, any modification occurring in the Volumes module is instantaneously applied to the volume rendering

parameters.label: Volume Properties
parameters.description: Advanced views of the transfer functions.
parameters.parameter: Left button clicklabel> Set current point or create a new point if no point is under the mouse.

parameter.label: Left button move
parameter.description: Move the current or selected points if any.

parameter.label: Right button click
parameter.description: Select/unselect point. Selected points can be moved at once

parameter.label: Right button move
parameter.description: Define an area to select points:

parameter.label: Middle button click
parameter.description: Delete point under the mouse cursor.

parameter.label: Right/Left arrow keys
parameter.description: Change of current point

parameter.label: Delete key
parameter.description: Delete the current point and set the next point as current

parameter.label: Backspace key
parameter.description: Delete the current point and set the previous point as current

parameter.label: ESC key
parameter.description: Unselect all points.

parameter.label: Unsupported
parameter.description: "ALT to move selected points", "CTRL-A to select all points"

parameter.label: Control Inputs:
parameter.description:
X: scalar value
     O: opacity
     M: mid-point
     S: sharpness

parameter.label: Scalar Opacity Mapping
parameter.description: Opacity transfer function. Threshold mode: enabling threshold controls the transfer function using range sliders in addition to control points.

parameter.label: Scalar Color Mapping
parameter.description: Color transfer function.

parameter.label: Gradient Opacity
parameter.description: Gradient opacity transfer function. This controls the opacity according to how large a density gradient next to the voxel is.

parameter.label: Interpolation
parameter.description: Linear (default for scalar volumes) or nearest neighbor (default for labelmaps) interpolation.

parameter.label: Shade
parameter.description: Enable/Disable shading. Shading uses light and material properties.

parameter.label: Material
parameter.description: Material properties of the volume to compute shading effect.

parameter.label: ROI
parameter.description: More controls for the cropping box.

parameter.label: Display Clipping box
parameter.description: Show hide the bounds of the ROI box.

parameter.label: Interactive mode
parameter.description: Control whether the cropping box is instantaneously updated when dragging the sliders or only when the mouse button is released.
